greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle of numbers of partitions of n with m parts which are all odd.
formula: T(n, m) := 0 if 1 <= n < m, else T(n, m) = number of partitions of n with m parts which are all odd. Hence T(2*k, 2*j-1) = 0, k >= 1, k >= j >= 1; T(2*k-1, 2*j) = 0, k >= 1, k-1 >= j >= 1.
T(n, k) = T(n-1, k-1) + T(n-2*k, k). If n+k is even, T(n, k) = A008284((n+k)/2, k) = A072233((n-k)/2, k); 0 otherwise. - _Álvar Ibeas_, Jul 25 2020
example: T(6,2)=2 because 6 = 1+5 = 3+3; T(6,1) = 0 = T(6,3): there are no partitions of 6 into either one or three parts with only odd numbers;
maple: g:=1/product(1-t*x^(2*j-1),j=1..30)-1: gser:=simplify(series(g,x=0,17)): for n from 1 to 15 do P[n]:=sort(coeff(gser,x^n)) od: seq(seq(coeff(P[n],t^j),j=1..n),n=1..15); # _Emeric Deutsch_, Feb 24 2006
xref: Row sums: A000009 (number of partitions of n into odd parts).
Cf. A008284 (partitions of n into k parts).
results.author: _Wolfdieter Lang_, Aug 13 2004
